profileText: A Representative from South Carolina; born near Kingstree, Williamsburg County, S.C., March 20, 1764; was educated in Charleston, S.C., and in Europe; engaged in planting; elected as a Republican to the Thirteenth Congress (March 4, 1813-March 3, 1815); resumed agricultural pursuits; died in Pineville, S.C., January 17, 1826; interment in Episcopal Cemetery, St. Stephen, S.C.

researchRecord.name: In the Gourdin Allied Family Papers, 1707-1903, approxiately 2.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers (1784-1825) of Theodore Gourdin consist of correspondence, receipts, plats, and other documents concerning Gourdin family properties in Berkeley, Charleston, Clarendon, Georgetown, Orangeburg, Sumter, and Williamsburg counties.

researchRecord.name: In the Gourdin Family Papers, 1707-1903, 3.125 linear feet.
